data.title: Mass. State Lottery winner: $10,000 a month for 10 years prize claimed Monday
data.meta_description: The $10,000 a month for 10 years lottery prize was claimed on Monday.
data.text:
A lottery player in Massachusetts won a $10,000 a month for 10 years lottery prize and came forward to claim the winning $5 scratch ticket on Monday, the Massachusetts State Lottery said.

The winning ticket was sold in Spencer, from a shop called X Press Mart. It was from the scratch ticket game called “$5 Decade of Dollars,” which costs $5 per ticket to play.

The lottery player claimed their $10,000 a month for 10 years lottery prize, the highest prize available to win in a game, on Monday, Oct. 16. There is just one grand prize remaining to be claimed in the game as of Oct. 17.

Read more: Mass. State Lottery winner: Great-grandma won $1M five days after retiring

The winner had the option of claiming the prize in its annuity form, which would be a total of $1.2 million before taxes, or the cash option of $780,000 before taxes. The X Press Mart will receive a $12,000 bonus for the selling the winning ticket, the lottery said.

Another lottery prize claimed Monday was sold at a Cumberland Farms gas station in Norton. It was a $100,000 scratch ticket from the game “20X Cash,” which costs $2 to play.

Overall, there were at least 798 lottery prizes worth $600 or more won or claimed in Massachusetts on Monday, including 20 in Springfield and 23 in Worcester.

The Massachusetts State Lottery releases a full list of all the winning tickets each day. The list only includes winning tickets worth more than $600.

Read more: Mass. State Lottery winner: This store sold four $100K ‘Mass Cash’ tickets

The two largest lottery prizes won in the state of Massachusetts so far in 2023 were $33 million and $31 million Mega Millions jackpot prizes. The tickets were each sold a week apart.

The $33 million ticket for the Tuesday, Jan. 24 drawing was purchased from a Stop & Shop in Belchertown. The winner came forward to claim the prize on March 1 through the Skylark Group Trust.
